alert.note: Alert for Brown; Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 11:57AM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Kansas. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 1 AM CST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you cover all exposed skin. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee
